dishes.name: Pav Bhaji
recipe: Rinse, peel, and chop the vegetables of your choice, such as cauliflower, carrots, potatoes, and green peas
In a pressure cooker or a pot, add the chopped vegetables and cook them until they are soft and tender. You can also use an Instant Pot for convenience
In a separate pan, heat butter or oil.
Add finely chopped onions and sauté until they become translucent.
Cook the bhaji on low heat for a few minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together. You can also add a little water if needed to adjust the consistency
Place the pav buns on the butter and toast them until they become slightly crispy and golden brown on the inside
Serve the hot pav bhaji with the toasted pav buns

dishes.name: Chocolate Truffles
ingredients: 8 ounces (about 1 1/3 cups) high-quality bittersweet or semi-sweet chocolate, finely chopped
2 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature
- Chopped nuts (e.g., almonds, hazelnuts, or pistachios)
- Melted chocolate for dipping (white, dark, or milk chocolate)
recipe: Chop the chocolate finely and place it in a heatproof bowl.
In a small saucepan, heat the heavy cream over medium heat until it just begins to simmer. Do not let it boil.
Pour the hot cream over the chopped chocolate. Let it sit for a minute to soften the chocolate, then gently stir until the mixture is smooth and all the chocolate is melted.
Stir in the room temperature butter, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt. Mix until everything is well combined and the mixture is smooth and shiny.
Allow the chocolate mixture to cool to room temperature. Once cooled, cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2-3 hours or until the mixture is firm enough to handle.
Once the mixture is firm, use a melon baller, spoon, or your hands to scoop out small portions of the mixture and roll them into round truffle balls. Place them on a parchment-lined baking sheet.

You can leave the truffles plain, or coat them in various coatings. Some popular options include cocoa powder, chopped nuts, powdered sugar, and shredded coconut. Roll the truffles in your chosen coating until they are evenly covered.

If you prefer a chocolate shell around your truffles, melt some chocolate (white, dark, or milk) in a heatproof bowl over simmering water or in the microwave. Dip each truffle into the melted chocolate, let the excess drip off, and place them back on the parchment-lined sheet to set.
Let the coated truffles set in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes to firm up.

Once the truffles are set, transfer them to an airtight container and store them in the refrigerator until you're ready to enjoy them. Truffles taste best at room temperature, so remember to take them out a little before serving.

dishes.name: Paneer Butter Masala
ingredients: 200 grams of paneer (Indian cottage cheese), cubed
1/2 cup cashew nuts, soaked in warm water
1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste)
recipe: In a blender, make a smooth paste by blending the soaked cashew nuts with a little water. Set aside.
Heat butter and oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the finely chopped onion and sauté until it turns golden brown.
Add the ginger-garlic paste and sauté for another 1-2 minutes until the raw smell disappears.
Add the tomato puree and cook for 5-6 minutes until the oil starts to separate from the masala.
Stir in the red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for a couple of minutes to blend the spices into the masala.
Pour in the cashew nut paste and cook for another 2-3 minutes, stirring continuously.
Add water to achieve your desired consistency for the gravy. Simmer for 5-7 minutes until the gravy thickens.
Stir in the sugar and heavy cream. Mix well and let it simmer for another 2 minutes.
Add the cubed paneer and cook for 2-3 minutes until the paneer is heated through and coated with the creamy gravy.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and a drizzle of cream.
Serve hot with naan, roti, or rice. Enjoy your Paneer Butter Masala!

dishes.name: Kerala Sambar
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (e.g., drumsticks, carrots, pumpkin, beans, and eggplant), chopped
1/2 cup tamarind extract (from a lemon-sized ball of tamarind)
- 2-3 dried red chilies, broken into pieces
recipe: Wash the toor dal thoroughly and pressure cook it with enough water and a pinch of turmeric powder until it becomes soft and mushy. Set aside.
In a large pot, heat coconut oil and add mustard seeds. When they start to splutter, add fenugreek seeds, dried red chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté for a minute until fragrant.
Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.
Add the mixed vegetables and green chilies. Cook for a few minutes until they start to soften.
Stir in the chopped tomatoes and cook until they become mushy.
Add tamarind extract, turmeric powder, sambar powder, asafoetida, and salt. Mix well and bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the vegetables are cooked through.
Add the cooked toor dal and simmer for another 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sambar thickens.
In a separate small pan, heat coconut oil for tempering. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add fenugreek seeds, dried red chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté for a minute until aromatic.
Pour the tempering over the sambar and mix well.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
Serve hot with steamed rice or idli and enjoy your Kerala Sambar!

dishes.name: Shavarma
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken, beef, or lamb, thinly sliced
recipe: In a bowl, combine all the marinade ingredients: yogurt, olive oil, minced garlic, grated ginger, ground cumin, ground coriander, garam masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
Add the thinly sliced chicken to the marinade, ensuring it's well coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or longer for better flavor.
In a separate bowl, mix mayonnaise, yogurt, minced garlic, lemon juice, and salt. This will be your sauce.
